name: Pacific Club Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I chose this hotel for a short Easter getaway with my boyfriend based on all the positive reviews on this website, and I was not at all disappointed.
reviews.title: Loved it so much that we were sad to leave

reviews.text: The room was very clean and one of the biggest I have seen. We arrived late at night hence did not see the view from the room but what a view to wake up to the next morning! We had a room on the top floor (just below the rooftop) and the view was unblocked, and no, we did not hear any noise from the construction or have our view blocked by it.
reviews.title: Mixed Feelings

reviews.text: The restaurant was fantastic with a great variety of options. Boyfriend had the filet mignon which he claimed was fantastic. Breakfast was equally good with a buffet selection as well as a cooked to order menu. The mexican option (forgot what it is called) and the eggs benedict were especially good.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel enjoyed every minute

reviews.text: The rooftop pool was fantastic, partly due to the view around it, with the forest behind as well as the sea view in front, and partly due to the landscaping which added to the wonderful ambience around it. The various "enclaves" set around the pool allows for guests to lounge and relax away in the pool which admiring the sea view. Boyfriend and I loved the pool so much that we spent the time after checking out and before our flight back lounging in the pool. There is a jacuzzi pool in the landscaped gardens below as well which doesn't seem much at first other than a small pool with two waterfalls but once u found the jacuzzi switches (next to the landscaping close to the waterfalls), the jacuzzi packed a powerful refreshing punch which was welcomed after the walk back up from Karon in the heat.
reviews.title: 3 1/2 star for 3 star money

reviews.text: The hotel is located away from the hustle and bustle of Karon itself so a 15 minute walk is required. I never had a problem with the walk, it wasn't as far as it looked. While I did wish at times (usually while walking) that the hotel was closer to where the action was, I suppose that if the hotel was indeed closer, then it wouldn't have been as private and as exclusive, which was part of its charm.
reviews.title: Best holiday ever.
Fantastic
reviews.text: I stayed at the Pacific Club in November with my Mother and Father. I'd been to Thailand before but not stayed in Phuket and was very excited, especially as the reports on here said that the hotel was great. We certainly weren't disappointed!

reviews.title: Best kept secret in Phuket.
reviews.text: I stayed for two weeks and my parents were lucky enough to stay for three but I wish I'd been able to stay longer!

reviews.title: Not right for us but gorgeous hotel just the same.
reviews.text: The rooms were extremely comfortable, spacious and very clean. The shower was amazing! It was also great to have a big fridge to store water. My balcony looked onto the 'new build' next door and didn't hear any noise whatsoever. The only slight concern I had was in a morning when I opened my curtains the workmen were looking over, but other than that you wouldn't have known they were building at all. We went out and about during the day so don't know what it was like at that time of day.

reviews.title: Beautiful hotel and wonderful staff
reviews.text: The food was delicious and the menu varied. We like to eat out in an evening, but as the food was so good we stopped in the hotel quite a few times and ate there.

reviews.title: Lovely Hotel and friendly staff
reviews.text: We didn't use any of the spa treatments so I'm afraid I can't comment on them. The swimming pool was especially pretty but as the beach was so close by we hardly used it.

We didn't like this hotel. Far from the sea, large area is under reconstraction now, small waterpool, but rather beatiful. Staff was unfriendly, room was dirty with sand on the floor. We didn't feel thai atmosphere there. Good restaurant.
reviews.title: I don't understand so happy reviewes.
Little Gem
reviews.text: We have just returned after a 3 week stay at the Pacific Club Resort we had a wonderful time can't fault the place so layed back.The staff friendliest we have encountered anywhere on our travels round Thailand over the last 15 years,food great,sevice excellent,we will be back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thanks for great holiday
reviews.title: Loved the PCRS
Good value, friendly staff, decent location
reviews.text: Shaun & Sally UK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We selected the Pacific Club based on TA good reviews (especially Richard's from Phuket Pro Dive), the fact that the owner reads the reviews and responds is a bonus. This property is simply wonderful.......all staff are helpful and friendly, the food is DELICIOUS and the restaurant is spotless. Tthe pool outstanding. We are frequent travellers and this is the 1st time we preferred a pool to the beach) and the 1st sauna I have ever truly enjoyed. The rooms are comfortable and spacious with plenty of closet space. Housekeeping actually cleans the room each day instead of just making up the bed. We stayed 6 night and then came back 11 nights later for an additional 5 nights and received the same room we were previously in. Pacific Club Resort and Spa is truly one of the highlights of our first trip to Thailand.
reviews.title: Wonderful Holiday Experience

likes.disliked: — Road to property needs to be upgraded.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the hotel and flight package through Expedia, but as this was our honeymoon, we emailed the hotel to see if they offered any special packages we could take advantage of. They promptly emailed back saying they woud upgrade our room! And this was in the full swing of Easter when the hotel appeared to be full!!
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel!

reviews.text: We arrived to the hotel around 9pm, and were greeted by the receptionist by name who showed us to our room - 204 - a lovely, large suite decorated beautifully with flowers all over the bed!!!
reviews.title: Terrific at the Pacific

likes.liked: — The large rooms and the rooftop pool

description: Pacific Club is a small one-of-a-kind boutique resort set in a relaxing jungle beach atmosphere surrounded by panoramic ocean and jungle mountain views only 10 minutes walk from Karon Beach or village. Our rooftop swimming pool, gym, spa, herbal steam sauna w/Jacuzzi, reasonably priced friendly services, and fine dining insure comfort for most all travelers. Free Wifi & Private Cable TV keep you connected. We've been rated between 3.5-5 stars by travel professionals; please decide for yourself. Welcome Home.
